line.comment: * no dead factions and no Yaki before their revolution
* Add-Ons 1.3: Only the player is allowed if the player has no sectors.
* ZH 2.0 - if player decided to join the OCV his territory does no longer contribute to the commonwealth empire size. In this case Phanon also joins commonwealth and contributes territory
* ZH 2.0 - if player decided to join the OCV his power does no longer contribute to the commonwealth total power. In this case Phanon also joins commonwealth and contributes power
* we multiply by 100 to get two decimals so we can later put this in better proportion between factions
* Mordan4 - save race power levels in global. This is a very costly call and we don't want to make it in real-time.
* Add-Ons 1.3: On insane, power milestone is reduced to 1/4 as much. As the default is 2000, 500 means this is when the first Renegade roamer spawns on insane mode.

line.text: 'DEBUG: check for player power nation goal / has: '

line.comment: * Tutorial: expanding too fast. Add-Ons 1.3: No tutorial on insane.
* ZH 2.0 - if player decided to join the OCV his territory does contribute to the Terraformer empire size. (Phanon does never contribute to Xenon territory)
* OCV military score (added the Xenon with their many defenders here. OCV alone did never accumulate enough power for the global alliance to trigger)
* ZH 2.0 - if player decided to join the OCV his territory does contribute to the Terraformer total power. (Phanon does never contribute to Xenon power)
* after global Xenon crisis the OCV builds much slower but they eventually recover
* 'OCV grinding' is a number of AI cycles for which the OCV will try to build up overwhelming forces before attacking and also concentrates fleets more
* only during a Xenon Crisis when the factions control all sectors adjacent to the OCV portal
* rubberbanding spec bonus for main factions based on comparison with Terraformers
* Xenon territory size + OCV power must have dropped far enough
* at this point the Xenon should be so weak that we can just end it right there
* after Xenon Crisis: how far are we through the following peace period?
* player gets protection money if he has no infamy
* theoretical maximum is 7 million credits every 8h
* Add-Ons 1.3: No tutorial on insane and protection money is reduced by 1/3
* freighters - how many % of our previous ships did we loose recently?
* this value starts the game at 0. The 1st AI cycle is required to set the current freighter count which gets compared with the kills on the 2nd cycle.
* resetting kill count for next AI cycle
* Protector or Tyrant AI stays locked
* territory size comparison to other commonwealth factions
* military power comparison to other commonwealth factions
* OCV portal distance comparison to other commonwealth factions
* Secondary Threat in our alerted but not claimed sectors (including OCV/Xenon)
* example: Khaak Queen fleet has about 20 average strength
* Add-Ons 1.1: base max specialization is now computed inside ZH.Set.OutpostSpec. Cap removed.
* resource reserve 0 = starving, 1 = low, 2 = medium, 3 = high
* $t = $race + ' SPEC debug report:' + ' / territory from average: ' + $territory.race.p + '%' + ' / strength from average: ' + $strength.race.p + '%'
* after a Xenon Crisis be less aggressive and stockpile resources to rebuild the galaxy
* leaving full defense mode only possible with a big military
* if we didn't came here already in full defense mode we always first revert back to neutral stance
* full defense mode always wants peace with others and skips the offensive stance considerations
* champion doesn't care about caution or defense
* we need to reduce our offense. (Add-Ons 1.4: Chanegd strength.race.p from 130 to 120.
* we have become weaker than average and want peace
* Overextension (territory can be still quite large but military might be very weak)
* here we go in full defense panic mode
* we are still fine as long as we have lots of resources left
* once we start running low we better seek peace
* we are only a bit worried once we start running low on resources
* we are undisputed champion (can be reckless)
* we are among the strongest factions and rich (can be confident). Add-Ons 1.4: changed strength from more than 130 to at least 120.
* we have access to shared resources and can continue our offense even when poor
* the champion can be stupid until he starts running out of resources
* Secondary Threat (only the enemies outside the primary faction war)
* 40% of our fleet power! (switch into panic mode)
* 20% of our fleet power! (start doing less offensive faction war)
* its not just lots of weak enemies, we need to call our heavy cavalry!

line.text: '- Rearguards ignore claims (secondary threat with capships)'

line.comment: * our secondary enemies are so weak that we can be more aggressive in the faction war, but only if we are stronger than average and also got som spare resources
* do we have a PIRATE problem?
* if we are not loosing many freighters we cannot have a pirate problem!
* we order extra Police squadrons if we still have some resources or if the pirates are a real issue.

line.text: ' - ordered 1 extra police to counter pirates'
' - ordered 2 extra escorts to counter pirates'

line.comment: * pirates trouble us so much that we generally get more cautious and want peace with everyone
* ** safe pathing around enemy/blacklisted sectors for all our workers and small squadrons? ***
* if we came her already using it we don't like switching it off that easily
* blacklisting all but our own sectors
* we always need access to at least 1 trading station!

line.text: ' - blacklisted everyone else (full defense AI with low resources)'

line.comment: * blacklist our own enclave sectors when we are cautious and weak or poor
* start blacklisting furthest away enclaves and never exceed 20% of total territory!
* needs at least 1 M6 enemy or faction claim

line.text: ' (cautious or full defense AI with low resources)'

line.comment: * blacklist our own secondary threat sectors
* needs at least 1 M2 secondary threat enemy or similar
* we also steer our rearguards to secondary threat sectors to clear the enemies which caused us to blacklist them

line.text: '- Rearguards ignore claims (blacklisted own sectors because of secondary threat)'

line.comment: * get another Rearguard to ensure our survival
* something has put us into full defense panic mode
* more Battlegroups - to prepare for our future counterattack, or if we are very rich, or during a global Xenon crisis
* the average power of our current squadrons determines how many new squadrons we can order at once
* build more Task Forces when we want to go raiding
* reckless AI orders 2 squadrons at once

line.text: ' - ordered extra Task Forces for raiding'

line.comment: * build more Task Forces because some main empire seems to be raiding us. We loose many freighters but don't have many pirates or secondary enemies around!

line.text: ' - ordered extra Task Force to defend against raids'

line.comment: * build more Border Patrols against the secondary threat
* only if they don't have too many huge ships!

line.text: ' - ordered extra Border Patrol to defend against the secondary threat'

line.comment: * if they got capships we should counter them with additional Rearguards instead!

line.text: ' - ordered extra Rearguard against roaming secondary threat with capships!'

line.comment: * MERCENARY hiring & activating RING OF FIRE PERK
* hires a limited number of standard mercs (permanent) and some/all Nomad mercs (temporary)
* everyone gets a flat 10% chance to hire all available Nomad mercs (temporary).
* vote pro Alliance if you want peace in general or fear the Terraformers

line.text: ' - is voting for a global alliance'

line.comment: * stop being Galactic Protector or Tyrant after becoming too weak

line.text: ' - lost special personality after being the strongest no more'

line.comment: * Add-Ons 1.4: changed strength from more than 170 to at least 120. Also fixed RNG not rolling negative numbers and decreased personality roll by 50 on insane (still 30 on hard).
* RNG cannot roll negative numbers! See Mayhem.Task.OCVVirus.xml for similar solution.
* Simulate RNG between -99 to 100 (original) by rolling 0 to 199, then subtract by 99.

line.text: ' - became the Galactic Protector with Ethos:'

line.comment: * ZH 2.0 - no Exodus attempt right after Xenon crisis was won
* inform player about possible non-aggression pact
* 1.7 continue to hire new Mercs during crisis
* 1.8 declare war against player. Add-Ons 1.3: No border required to declare war.
* only on hard and insane difficulty. player must have completed his nation goals
* cannot have truce desire, full defense AI, coalition or permanent war
* controlling any dejure sector quadruples war risk
* race ethos % multiplies the war chance by half
* relative military power between player and the NPC faction reduces their war chance
* player overextension can double the war chance
* Mordan9 - It's about time. Your Notoriety you've earned with the race affects their desire
* to go to war with you. Common sense for gods sake.
* Mordan9 - Its about time. Chances you are wardec'd go up if you are playing on Hard Difficulty.
* Add-Ons 1.3: War chance is doubled on insane (33% more than hard)
* If you are the same race they are 4 times less likely to war-dec you. Racists stick together.
* total wars reduce war chance based on amount of enemies
* Mordan9. Infamy now does 3x instead of 2x.
* Add-Ons 1.3: On insane, border is not required (flag always set to true regardless).
* only the Tyrant or a neighbor can declare war on player
* Phanon never wants galactic unification, exodus or Non-aggression pacts
* declare because Terraformers already have enough progress
* maybe declare prematurely because factions want it
* an absolute council majority is voting pro alliance
* ZH 2.0 - premature triggering of the crisis is now impossible if more than half of all votes are still contra
* less likely to sway Terracorp based on how far away Terraformers progress still is from their goals
* debug report. Herobetty: I'll temporarily set this condition to true so that I can see the info in the logbook. Change back to $showDebugZH when done.

line.text: '% / no chance for an Alliance at this level of Xenon/OCV progress'

line.comment: * Herobetty: Reduced the number of mercs spawned. This is for both performance reasons and balancing. Previously, between 4-8 calls were made; this is now reduced to 2-6 calls.
* cancel all claims. Herobetty: if player sided with OCV, don't cancel claims.
* sign player truce - gets refreshed by ZH.Monitor
* reset player reputation. Herobetty: do not reset if player joined OCV.
* create OCV hunter fleets, further maintained by ZH.Monitor
* new Truces between NPCs (these are basically non-aggression pacts. Only standard truces but which are constantly refreshed by ZH.Monitor)
* don't try a new CI everytime
* don't do any CIs immediately after a Xenon Crisis has started (fleets need to sort themselves out)
* we always need to properly abort the operation if the attempt has failed
* each faction can have only 1 CI active at the same time
* during a Global Alliance we don't attempt any other type of CI !!!
* use most of your Battlegroups against high value adjacent Xenon sectors and not against other factions
* slowly repair global distrust against player (-5% and -2 absolute) Truces are offered to player only if this is 0.
* Add-Ons 1.4: No infamy decay for OCV players. Notify the player if infamy has decayed.
* Add-Ons 1.4.14: Fixed decay message saying 1 points. Now says 1 point.
* $t = 'The Galaxy unites to fight the Terraformers!'
* START [NULL]-> call script 'Mayhem.StackNews' : text=$t addToHistory=[TRUE] breakingNews=[TRUE]
* ZH 2.0: reduced from 1 leader per 9 sectors to 1 per 12 sectors
* ZH 2.0: removed. Too much can break when the Maelstrom doesnt exist. (new storyline)
* chance to turn into a pirate gang already at half the usual nomad merc limit, but only for already hired leaders ZH2.0: hired no longer required
* player with infamy can't get betrayed because they fear you

line.text: ' has gone rogue and created a new pirate gang'

sval.val: DEBUG: check for player power nation goal / has:
- Rearguards ignore claims (secondary threat with capships)
- ordered 1 extra police to counter pirates
- ordered 2 extra escorts to counter pirates
- blacklisted everyone else (full defense AI with low resources)
(cautious or full defense AI with low resources)
- Rearguards ignore claims (blacklisted own sectors because of secondary threat)
- ordered extra Task Forces for raiding
- ordered extra Task Force to defend against raids
- ordered extra Border Patrol to defend against the secondary threat
- ordered extra Rearguard against roaming secondary threat with capships!
- is voting for a global alliance
- lost special personality after being the strongest no more
- became the Galactic Protector with Ethos:
% / no chance for an Alliance at this level of Xenon/OCV progress
has gone rogue and created a new pirate gang
no dead factions and no Yaki before their revolution
Add-Ons 1.3: Only the player is allowed if the player has no sectors.
ZH 2.0 - if player decided to join the OCV his territory does no longer contribute to the commonwealth empire size. In this case Phanon also joins commonwealth and contributes territory
ZH 2.0 - if player decided to join the OCV his power does no longer contribute to the commonwealth total power. In this case Phanon also joins commonwealth and contributes power
we multiply by 100 to get two decimals so we can later put this in better proportion between factions
Mordan4 - save race power levels in global. This is a very costly call and we don't want to make it in real-time.
Add-Ons 1.3: On insane, power milestone is reduced to 1/4 as much. As the default is 2000, 500 means this is when the first Renegade roamer spawns on insane mode.
Tutorial: expanding too fast. Add-Ons 1.3: No tutorial on insane.
ZH 2.0 - if player decided to join the OCV his territory does contribute to the Terraformer empire size. (Phanon does never contribute to Xenon territory)
OCV military score (added the Xenon with their many defenders here. OCV alone did never accumulate enough power for the global alliance to trigger)
ZH 2.0 - if player decided to join the OCV his territory does contribute to the Terraformer total power. (Phanon does never contribute to Xenon power)
after global Xenon crisis the OCV builds much slower but they eventually recover
'OCV grinding' is a number of AI cycles for which the OCV will try to build up overwhelming forces before attacking and also concentrates fleets more
only during a Xenon Crisis when the factions control all sectors adjacent to the OCV portal
rubberbanding spec bonus for main factions based on comparison with Terraformers
Xenon territory size + OCV power must have dropped far enough
at this point the Xenon should be so weak that we can just end it right there

player gets protection money if he has no infamy
theoretical maximum is 7 million credits every 8h

freighters - how many % of our previous ships did we loose recently?
this value starts the game at 0. The 1st AI cycle is required to set the current freighter count which gets compared with the kills on the 2nd cycle.

Secondary Threat in our alerted but not claimed sectors (including OCV/Xenon)

debug report. Herobetty: I'll temporarily set this condition to true so that I can see the info in the logbook. Change back to $showDebugZH when done.
Herobetty: Reduced the number of mercs spawned. This is for both performance reasons and balancing. Previously, between 4-8 calls were made; this is now reduced to 2-6 calls.
cancel all claims. Herobetty: if player sided with OCV, don't cancel claims.
sign player truce - gets refreshed by ZH.Monitor
reset player reputation. Herobetty: do not reset if player joined OCV.
create OCV hunter fleets, further maintained by ZH.Monitor
new Truces between NPCs (these are basically non-aggression pacts. Only standard truces but which are constantly refreshed by ZH.Monitor)
don't try a new CI everytime
don't do any CIs immediately after a Xenon Crisis has started (fleets need to sort themselves out)
we always need to properly abort the operation if the attempt has failed
each faction can have only 1 CI active at the same time
during a Global Alliance we don't attempt any other type of CI !!!
use most of your Battlegroups against high value adjacent Xenon sectors and not against other factions
slowly repair global distrust against player (-5% and -2 absolute) Truces are offered to player only if this is 0.
Add-Ons 1.4: No infamy decay for OCV players. Notify the player if infamy has decayed.
Add-Ons 1.4.14: Fixed decay message saying 1 points. Now says 1 point.
$t = 'The Galaxy unites to fight the Terraformers!'
START [NULL]-> call script 'Mayhem.StackNews' : text=$t addToHistory=[TRUE] breakingNews=[TRUE]
ZH 2.0: reduced from 1 leader per 9 sectors to 1 per 12 sectors
ZH 2.0: removed. Too much can break when the Maelstrom doesnt exist. (new storyline)
chance to turn into a pirate gang already at half the usual nomad merc limit, but only for already hired leaders ZH2.0: hired no longer required
player with infamy can't get betrayed because they fear you
